title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 3 to the n = 2 energy state

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 3 to the n = 1 energy state

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 2 to the n = 1 energy state

One earned point deducted if there were any incorrect or extra lines on the diagram.
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 3 to the n = 2 energy state

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 3 to the n = 1 energy state

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 2 to the n = 1 energy state

One earned point deducted if there were any incorrect or extra lines on the diagram.

The student earns one of the following points:

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 3 to the n = 2 energy state

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 3 to the n = 1 energy state

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 2 to the n = 1 energy state

One earned point deducted if there were any incorrect or extra lines on the diagram.

The student earns two of the following points:

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 3 to the n = 2 energy state

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 3 to the n = 1 energy state

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 2 to the n = 1 energy state

One earned point deducted if there were any incorrect or extra lines on the diagram.

The student earns three of the following points:

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 3 to the n = 2 energy state

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 3 to the n = 1 energy state

1 point(s) earned for: an arrow from n = 2 to the n = 1 energy state

One earned point deducted if there were any incorrect or extra lines on the diagram.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Use an expression relating energy to wavelength

E = hf = hc/λ

1 point(s) earned for: substitution using the correct 3 to 2 transition energy

λ = hc/E = (1240 eV⋅nm) / ((3.0 - 0.75) eV)

1 point(s) earned for:an answer consistent with whichever transition was chosen

λ = 551 nm or 5.51 x 10-7 m

(138 nm for the 2 to 1 transition, and 110nm for the 3 to 1 transition)

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned for: the correct, positive value for the ionization energy

E = 12eV or 1.9 x 10-18 J
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

1 point(s) earned for: the correct, positive value for the ionization energy

E = 12eV or 1.9 x 10-18 J

The student earns one of the following points:

1 point(s) earned for: the correct, positive value for the ionization energy

E = 12eV or 1.9 x 10-18 J

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned for: correctly stating that an 11.0 eV photon has no effect:

1 point(s) earned for: a correct explanation

Example:

Since there is no energy level at -1.0 eV, and 11.0 eV photon will have no effect on electrons in the -12.0 eV (n=1) energy state.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned for: correctly stating that a 14.0 eV photon will remove the electron from the atom

1 point(s) earned for: a correct explanation

Example:

A 14.0 eV photon has sufficient energy to ionize the atom, since only 12.0 eV is required for ionization.
